member.name: T:MccDaq.cBoardConfig
member.summary: Provides all of the members responsible for getting and setting board-level configuration items.
member.remarks: All instances of cBoardConfig are derived from the MccBoard. property.

example.code:
Dim Status As ErrorInfo Dim Board0 As MccBoard Dim BoardType As Integer Dim NumAdChans As Integer
Board0 = New MccBoard(0) Status = Board0.BoardConfig.GetNumAdChans(NumAdChans) NumAdChans = 8 Status = Board0.BoardConfig.SetNumAdChans(NumAdChans)

member.param: instance whose configuration you want to set and get.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cBoardConfig.GetDACUpdateMode(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the update mode for a digital-to-analog converter (DAC).
member.param: Returns a number indicating the DAC update mode (0 = immediate, 1 = on command).
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

remarks.para: If returns 0, the DAC update mode is immediate. Values written with method or method are automatically output by the DAC channels.
If returns 1, the DAC update mode is set to on command.
Values written with AOut or AOutScan are not output by the DAC channels until a method call is made.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cBoardConfig.SetDACUpdateMode(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the update mode for a digital-to-analog converter (DAC).
member.param: Specifies the number of the channel whose update mode you want set.

item.description: When set to 0, the DAC update mode is immediate. Values written with method or method are automatically output by the DAC channels.
When set to 1, the DAC update mode is on command. Values written with AOut or AOutScan are not output by the DAC channel(s) until a method call is made.

member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cBoardConfig.DACUpdate

summary.para: Updates the voltage values on analog output channels.

member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

remarks.para: Usually called after a method call with its parameter set to 1 (on command).

member.name: M:MccDaq.cBoardConfig.SetDACStartup(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the Measurement Computing device's configuration register STARTUP bit to 0 or 1 to enable/disable the storing of digital-to-analog converter (DAC) startup values.
member.param: Enables (1) or disables (0) the storing of startup values for the channel.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.
member.remarks:
Each time the Measurement Computing DAC device is powered up, the stored values are written to the DACs. New DAC start-up values are stored in memory by calling method or method after calling SetDacStartup with the argument set to 1.
Use the SetDACStartup method to store the DAC values you would like each DAC channel to be set to each time the Measurement Computing device is powered up.
To store the current DAC values as start-up values, call SetDACStartup with a value of 1. Then, each time you call AOut or AOutScan, the value written for each channel is stored in NV RAM. The last value written to a particular channel while SetDACStartup is set to 1 is the value that channel will be set to at power up.
Call SetDACStartup again with a value of 0 to stop storing values in NV RAM.
Accessible from the property.

member.summary: Gets the selected voltage range. For switch-selectable gains only.
member.param: Upon return, contains the selected voltage .
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

remarks.para: If the selected Measurement Computing A/D device does not have a programmable gain feature, this method returns the range as defined by the installed InstaCal settings. If InstaCal and the Measurement Computing device are installed correctly, the range returned corresponds to the input range set by switches on the board.
Refer to the Universal Library User's Guide for a list of the A/D ranges supported by each Measurement Computing device.

member.name: M:MccDaq.DataLogger.GetFileName(System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Returns the name of the nth file in the directory containing binary log files.
member.param: Index of the file whose name you want to return.
The full path of the directory containing the log files.
Upon return, contains the full path and name of the binary file. The path is null-terminated and is not longer than 256 characters.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

item.description:
parameter options
Specify one of the following:
The number (n) that represents the location of the file in the directory (where n = 0, 1, 2, and so on)
- get the first file in the directory
- get the next file in the directory based on the current location.
This parameter is the index of the file in the directory, and is not part of the filename.
To access all of the files in a directory, first call this method with set to , then continue with the set to until the method returns the error code .

member.name: M:MccDaq.DataLogger.GetSampleInfo(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the sample interval, sample count, and the date and time of the first data point in a binary file.
member.param: Upon return, contains the number of seconds between samples.
Upon return, contains the number of samples in the file.

Upon return, contains the date of the first data point logged in the file. Date values are packed in the following format:
Byte 0: Day
Byte 1: Month
Bytes 2-3: Year

Upon return, contains the time of the first data point logged in the file. Time values are packed in the following format:
Byte 0: Seconds
Byte 1: Minutes
Byte 2: Hours
Byte 3: 0xff = 24-hour format
0x0 - AM
0x1 - PM
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.DataLogger.ReadTimeTags(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Returns date and time values logged in a binary file. This method stores date values in the array, and time values in the array.
member.param: The position of the first sample to read from the binary file.
The number of samples to read from the binary file.

Upon return, contains the date tag values. Dates are packed in the following format:
Byte 0: Day
Byte 1: Month
Bytes 2-3: Year

Upon return, contains the time tag values. Time values are packed in the following format:
Byte 0: Seconds
Byte 1: Minutes
Byte 2: Hours
Byte 3: 0xff = 24-hour format
0x0 - AM
0x1 - PM
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

item.description:
Use the method to set the time zone ( parameter) and time format ( parameter) used to store timestamp data.
Timestamp data are logged in the file if InstaCal is configured to do so. If time stamps are not logged, the time array is filled with values calculated from the file header information.

member.name: M:MccDaq.DataLogger.ReadAIChannels(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Returns analog input data from a binary file, and stores the values in an array.
member.param: The position of the first sample to read from the binary file.
The number of samples to read from the binary file.
Upon return, contains the analog input data from the logger file.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

item.description:
The unit of the analog input data that is returned is set by the value of the parameter of the method.
The units preference is only applied if the logged data is temperature data. This value is ignored if the data logged is raw.

You are responsible for allocating the size of the analog array, and making sure that it is large enough to hold the data that is returned. You can calculate the array allocation using the value from the method, and the value from the method.

member.name: M:MccDaq.DataLogger.ConvertFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,MccDaq.FieldDelimiter)
member.summary: Converts a binary log file to a comma-separated values (.CSV) text file or another text file format that you specify.
member.param: Sets name and destination path of the converted file. Use the file extension of the file type that you want to create.
The line number in the file containing the first sample to read.
The number of samples to read.

param.name: delimiter
param.para: that sets the character to use between fields in the converted file. The character options are enumerated constants.

member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

item.description: Time stamp data is stored according to the method's and parameters.

Time stamps in the converted file may be in either 12-hour or 24-hour format based on the value of the timeFormat preference. Time stamps can optionally be converted to local time based on the value of the method's parameter.

AI temperature data is stored according to the method's parameter.
The parameter is only valid if the logged data is temperature data. This value is ignored if the data logged is raw. The parameter is always applied to CJC data, since it is always logged as temperature data.

If the parameter ends with a .CSV extension, the parameter must be set to ; otherwise, an error occurs. You can open a .CSV file directly in Microsoft Excel. Text files with extensions other than .CSV can only be imported into Excel.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetDevType(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the type of a digital port on a Measurement Computing device.
member.param: Number of the digital device.
Upon return, contains the constant that indicates the type of digital port (AUXPORT, FIRSTPORTA, and so on).
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetConfig(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the configuration of a Measurement Computing digital device.
member.param: Number of the Measurement Computing digital device whose configuration setting you want to get.
Upon return, contains the current digital configuration of the Measurement Computing device ( 1 = DigitalOut, 2 = DigitalIn).
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetNumBits(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the number of bits in a digital port on a Measurement Computing device.
member.param: Number of the Measurement Computing digital device (as assigned by InstaCal).
Upon return, contains the number of bits in the digital port.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetCurVal(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the current value of a digital output.
member.param: Number of the Measurement Computing digital device whose digital output value you want to get.
Upon return, contains the current value of the Measurement Computing device's digital output.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetDInMask(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the bits on a specified port that are configured for input.
member.param: Number of the port whose input bit configuration you want to get.
Upon return, contains the bit configuration of the specified port. Any bits that return a value of 1 are configured for input.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

remarks.para: Use GetDInMask with the method to determine if an AuxPort is configurable. If you apply both methods to the same port, and both parameters returned have input and output bits that overlap, the port is not configurable. You can determine overlapping bits by ANDing both parameters.

For example, if a Measurement Computing device has seven bits of digital I/O (four outputs and three inputs), the parameter returned by GetDInMask is always 7 (0000 0111), while the parameter returned by GetDOutMask is always 15 (0000 1111). When you And both parameters together, you get a non-zero number (7). Any non-zero number indicates that input and output bits overlap for the specified port, and that port is a non-configurable AuxPort .

member.name: M:MccDaq.cDioConfig.GetDOutMask(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines the bits on a specified port that are configured for output.
member.param: Number of the port whose output bit configuration you want to determine.
Upon return, contains the bit configuration of the specified port. Any bits that return a value of 1 are configured for output.
member.returns: An object that indicates the status of the operation.

remarks.para: Use GetDOutMask with the method to determine if an AuxPort is configurable. If you apply both methods to the same port, and both parameters returned have input and output bits that overlap, the port is not configurable. You can determine overlapping bits by ANDing both parameters.

For example, if a Measurement Computing device has seven bits of digital I/O (four outputs and three inputs), the parameter returned by GetDInMask is always 7 (0000 0111), while the parameter returned by GetDOutMask is always 15 (0000 1111). When you And both parameters together, you get a non-zero number (7). Any non-zero number indicates that input and output bits overlap for the specified port, and that port is a non-configurable AuxPort .

member.name: T:MccDaq.ErrorInfo
member.summary: Use to store and report error codes and messages

member.name: M:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an .

member.name: M:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an .
member.param: Number of the error to generate.

member.name: P:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.Value
member.summary: Gets the error constant associated with an ErrorInfo object. Most UL for .NET methods return an ErrorInfo object. If an error occurs, an ErrorInfo object is returned with a non-zero value in the Value property. Refer to the method for an alternate method of handling errors.
member.value: The default value is "0" (no error has occurred.)

member.name: P:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.Message
member.summary: Gets the error message associated with a specific error code (ErrorInfo object). Most UL for .NET methods return an ErrorInfo object. If no error occurred, an ErrorInfo object is returned with the Message property set to No error has occurred. Refer to the method for an alternate method of handling errors.
member.value: The default value is No error has occurred.

member.name: T:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode
member.summary: Provides functionality for storing and reporting error codes and messages. Error information is stored internally on the return from calling the low-level Universal Library function. The error is reported when the user calls the class library functions.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoErrors
member.summary:
Error code: 0
Message: No error has occurred.
The method executed successfully

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadBoard
member.summary:
Error code: 1
Message: Invalid board number.
The Measurement Computing device number that was specified does not match any of the Measurement Computing devices that are listed in the configuration file. Run the configuration program to check which Measurement Computing device numbers are configured.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DeadDigitalDev
member.summary:
Error code: 2
Message: Digital device is not responding - is base address correct?
The digital device on the specified Measurement Computing device is not responding. Either the Measurement Computing device was installed incorrectly or it is defective. Run InstaCal and make sure that the correct Measurement Computing device was installed.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DeadCounterDev
member.summary:
Error code: 3
Message: Counter device is not responding - is base address correct?
The counter device on the specified Measurement Computing device is not responding. Either the Measurement Computing device was installed incorrectly or the Measurement Computing device is defective. Run InstaCal and make sure that the correct Measurement Computing device was installed.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DeadDaDev
member.summary:
Error code: 4
Message: D/A is not responding - is base address correct?
The D/A device on the specified Measurement Computing device is not responding. Either the Measurement Computing device was installed incorrectly or it is defective. Run InstaCal and make sure that the correct Measurement Computing device was installed.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DeadAdDev
member.summary:
Error code: 5
Message: A/D is not responding - is base address correct?
The A/D device on the specified Measurement Computing device is not responding. Either the Measurement Computing device was installed incorrectly or the Measurement Computing device is defective. Run InstaCal and make sure that the correct Measurement Computing device was installed.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotDigitalConf
member.summary:
Error code: 6
Message: Selected board does not have digital I/O.
A digital I/O method was called with a Measurement Computing device number that referred to a Measurement Computing device that does not support digital I/O. Run the configuration program to see which type of Measurement Computing device that the board number refers to.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotCounterConf
member.summary:
Error code: 7
Message: Selected board does not have a counter.
A counter method was called with a Measurement Computing device number that referred to a Measurement Computing device that does not have a counter. Run the configuration program to see which type of Measurement Computing device that the board number refers to.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotDaConf
member.summary:
Error code: 8
Message: Selected board does not have a D/A.
An analog output method was called with a Measurement Computing device number that referred to a Measurement Computing device that does not have an analog output (D/A). Run the configuration program to see which type of Measurement Computing device that the board number refers to.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotAdConf
member.summary:
Error code: 9
Message: Selected board does not have an A/D.
An analog input method was called with a Measurement Computing device number that referred to a Measurement Computing device that does not have an analog input (A/D). Run the configuration program to see which type of Measurement Computing device that board number refers to.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotMuxConf
member.summary:
Error code: 10
Message: Selected board does not have thermocouple inputs.
A thermocouple input method was called with a Measurement Computing device number that does not support thermocouple inputs, or is not connected to a Measurement Computing EXP device. Run the configuration program to view/change the Measurement Computing device configuration.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadPortNum
member.summary:
Error code: 11
Message: Invalid digital port number.
The port number that was specified for a digital I/O method does not exist on the Measurement Computing device that was specified.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCounterDevNum
member.summary:
Error code: 12
Message: Invalid counter device.
The counter number that was specified for a counter method does not exist on the Measurement Computing device that was specified.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadDaDevNum
member.summary:
Error code: 13
Message: Invalid D/A device.
The D/A channel that was specified for an analog output method does not exist on the Measurement Computing device that was specified.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadSampleMode
member.summary:
Error code: 14
Message: Invalid sample mode.
A sample mode that is not supported on this Measurement Computing device (, or ) was specified in the options argument. Try running the method without setting any of the sample mode options.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadInt
member.summary:
Error code: 15
Message: Board configured for invalid interrupt level.
No interrupt was selected in InstaCal and one is required, or the Measurement Computing device is set for "compatible mode" and the interrupt level selected is not supported in this mode. Interrupts above 7 are not valid in compatible mode. Either change the switch setting on the Measurement Computing device to "enhanced mode," or change the interrupt level with the configuration program to something less than 8.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadAdChan
member.summary:
Error code: 16
Message: Invalid A/D channel number.
An invalid channel argument was passed to an analog input function. The range of valid channel numbers depends on which Measurement Computing A/D board you are using. For boards with switch-configurable ranges, run the configuration program and check how many channels the board is configured for.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCount
member.summary:
Error code: 17
Message: Invalid count.
An invalid count parameter was specified to a method.
If this error occurs during the method, increasing the count should correct the problem. For Measurement Computing devices using , adjust the data buffer and count above (highChan-lowChan+1)*rate/100 for mode scans. However, those Measurement Computing devices using require a user buffer and count large enough to hold at least one half FIFO worth of samples (typically, 512 samples) for Continuous mode scans.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCntrConfig
member.summary:
Error code: 18
Message: Invalid counter configuration specified.
An invalid config parameter was passed to the method. The only legal values are , , , , , and .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadDaVal
member.summary:
Error code: 19
Message: Invalid D/A value.
An invalid D/A value was passed as a parameter to an analog output method. The only legal values are 0 - 4095 for 12 bit Measurement Computing devices or 0-65,535 for 16 bit Measurement Computing devices (see notes on signed integers).

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadDaChan
member.summary:
Error code: 20
Message: Invalid D/A channel number.
An invalid D/A channel was passed as a parameter to an analog output method. The legal range of values depends on which D/A Measurement Computing device you are using. Refer to the Measurement Computing device manual to find how many D/A channels it has.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.AlreadyActive
member.summary:
Error code: 22
Message: Background operation already in progress.
An attempt was made to start a second background process on the same Measurement Computing device before the first one had completed. Background processes are started whenever the BACKGROUND option is used or by the method. To stop a background operation, call the method. To wait for a background process to complete, call the method and wait for status=IDLE.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.PageOverrun
member.summary:
Error code: 23
Message: DMA transfer crossed page boundary, may have gaps in data.
When a DMA transfer crosses a 64K memory page boundary on Measurement Computing devices without FIFO buffers, there may be a small gap (missing samples) in the data. For applications requiring high speed transfers of greater than 32K samples, please select a Measurement Computing device with a FIFO buffer. For Measurement Computing devices without, check the data for gaps and do not specify rates over that at which gap-less data may be taken. This is system specific and you must determine the rate by experimentation.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadRate
member.summary:
Error code: 24
Message: Invalid sampling rate.
Invalid sampling rate parameter was specified. The rate was either zero, a negative number or it was higher than the selected Measurement Computing device supports. Refer to Measurement Computing device-specific information for maximum rates for each Measurement Computing device.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CompatMode
member.summary:
Error code: 25
Message: Board switches set for Compatible mode.
An operation was attempted that is not possible when the Measurement Computing device's switch is set for 'compatible' operation. Most likely causes are using the option or the pre-triggering functions. Either turn off the 'compatible' mode switch on the Measurement Computing device or don't use the BlockIO option or the pre-triggering functions.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.TrigState
member.summary:
Error code: 26
Message: Incorrect initial trigger state - trigger must start at TTL low.
Boards that use "polled gate" triggering require that the trigger be "off" when a pre-trigger method is first called. It then waits for the trigger signal. Make sure that the Trigger Input line (usually D0) is held at TTL low before calling the pre-trigger method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.AdStatusHung
member.summary:
Error code: 27
Message: A/D is not responding.
The A/D Measurement Computing device is not responding as it should. Usually indicates some kind of hardware problem - either defective hardware or more than one board at the same base address.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.TooFew
member.summary:
Error code: 28
Message: Trigger occurred before requested number of samples were collected.
A pre-trigger method was called and the trigger signal occurred before the requested number of samples could be collected. This is only a warning message. The method continues anyway. The data that was returned to the array contains fewer than the expected number of points. The method returns the actual number of pre-trigger points and the total number of points.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Overrun
member.summary:
Error code: 29
Message: Data overrun - data was lost.
Data was lost during an analog input because the computer could not keep up with the A/D sampling rate. This typically can only happen with the file input methods or using mode. Possible solutions include lowering the sampling rate, defragmenting the "streamer" file, switching to a RAM disk, or lowering the count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadRange
member.summary:
Error code: 30
Message: Invalid voltage or current range.
Invalid Range parameter was specified to an analog input or output method. The Measurement Computing device does not support the gain you specified. Refer to Measurement Computing device-specific information for a list of allowable ranges for each Measurement Computing device.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoProgGain
member.summary:
Error code: 31
Message: This A/D board does not have programmable gain.
Invalid range parameter was passed to an analog input method. The selected Measurement Computing device does not support programmable gains so the only valid range parameter is 0. (This parameter is ignored for these Measurement Computing device types in later versions of the library.)

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadFileName
member.summary:
Error code: 32
Message: Specified file name is not valid.
The fileName parameter that was passed to a file method is not valid. It is either an empty string or a NULL pointer.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DiskIsFull
member.summary:
Error code: 33
Message: Disk is full, could not complete operation.
A file operation failed before completing because the disk that it was writing to is full. Try erasing some unneeded files from the disk.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CompatWarn
member.summary:
Error code: 34
Message: Board switch set to compatible mode - sampling speed may be limited.
The Measurement Computing device's switch is set for 'Compatible mode". When in "compatible mode" transfers are not possible. BlockIo sampling was specified but it has automatically been changed to transfers. The maximum sampling rate is limited to the maximum rate for DMA transfers. Change the "compatible mode" switch on the Measurement Computing device if you want to use BlockIo transfers.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadPointer
member.summary:
Error code: 35
Message: Pointer is not valid.
An invalid (NULL) pointer was passed as a parameter to a method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.TooManyGains
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.RateWarning
member.summary:
Error code: 37
Message: Sample rate may be too fast for SINGLEIO mode.
The specified sampling rate MAY be too high. The maximum allowable sampling rate depends very much on the computer that the program is running on. This warning is generated based on the slowest CPU speed. Your computer may be able to sustain faster rates, but, you should expect the computer to lock up (fail to respond to keyboard input) if you do exceed the sampling rate your computer can sustain.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.ConvertDma
member.summary:
Error code: 38
Message: CONVERTDATA cannot be used with DMA I/O and BACKGROUND.
The and options can not be used together when the Measurement Computing device is transferring data via DMA.
Possible solutions include:
Using the method to convert the data after it is collected. Do not use the Background option.
Using the option if your A/D Measurement Computing device supports it.
Using the option if your computer is fast enough to support the selected sampling rate.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DtConnectErr
member.summary:
Error code: 39
Message: Board does not support the DTCONNECT option.
The option was passed to an analog input method. The selected Measurement Computing device does not support that option.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.ForeContinuous
member.summary:
Error code: 40
Message: CONTINUOUS can only be run with BACKGROUND .
The option was passed to a method without also setting the option. This is not allowed. Any time you set the Continuous option you must also set the Background option.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadBoardType
member.summary:
Error code: 41
Message: This method can not be used with this board.
An attempt was made to call a method for a Measurement Computing device that does not support that method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.WrongDigConfig
member.summary:
Error code: 42
Message: Digital port not configured correctly for requested operation.
An attempt was made to use a digital input method on a port that was configured as an output or vice versa. Use the method or the method to switch the direction of the port or it's bits.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotConfigurable
member.summary:
Error code: 43
Message: This digital port is not configurable (it's an in/out port).
The method or the method was called for a port that is not configurable. Check the portNumber parameter and the Measurement Computing device documentation to make sure that it is configurable. If not, then there is no need to call this method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadPortConfig
member.summary:
Error code: 44
Message: Invalid digital port configuration.
The parameter passed to the method or the method is invalid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadFirstPoint
member.summary:
Error code: 45
Message: First point number is not valid.
The parameter to the method is invalid. It is either a negative number or it is larger then the number of points in the file.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.EndOfFile
member.summary:
Error code: 46
Message: Attempted to read past the end of the file.
The method attempted to read beyond the end of the file. Check the file length with the method and make sure that the firstPoint and count parameters to the method are correct for that file length.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Not8254Ctr
member.summary:
Error code: 47
Message: This board does not have an 8254 counter.
The method was called for a Measurement Computing device that has a counter but not an 8254 counter. This method can only be used with an 8254 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Not9513Ctr
member.summary:
Error code: 48
Message: This board does not have a 9513 counter.
A method was called for a Measurement Computing device that has a counter but not a 9513 counter. This method can only be used with a 9513 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadTrigType
member.summary:
Error code: 49
Message: Invalid TrigType.
method was called with an invalid trigType parameter. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadTrigValue
member.summary:
Error code: 50
Message: Invalid TrigValue.
method was called with an invalid trigValue parameter. It must be in the range 0 - 4095 for 12-bit Measurement Computing devices or 0 to 65535 for 16-bit Measurement Computing devices.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadOption
member.summary:
Error code: 52
Message: Invalid option specified for this method.
The option parameter contains an option that is not valid for this method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadPretrigCount
member.summary:
Error code: 53
Message: Invalid PreTrigCount specified.
Either the method or the method was called with an invalid preTrigCount parameter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadDivider
member.summary:
Error code: 55
Message: Invalid FOutDivider value.
The fOutDivider parameter for the method is not valid. It must be in the range 0 - 15.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadSource
member.summary:
Error code: 56
Message: Invalid FOutSource value.
The FOutSource parameter to method is not valid. It must be one of the following values: , , , , , , , , , , , , , , or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCompare
member.summary:
Error code: 57
Message: Invalid compare value.
One or both of the compare parameters to method are not valid. They must be set to or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadTimeOfDay
member.summary:
Error code: 58
Message: Invalid TimeOfDay value.
The timeOfDay parameter for the method is not valid. It must be set to either , , , or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadGateInterval
member.summary:
Error code: 59
Message: Invalid Gate Interval value.
The gateInterval parameter to method is not valid. It must be greater than 0.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadGateCntrl
member.summary:
Error code: 60
Message: Invalid Gate Control value.
The gateControl parameter to method is not valid. It must be in the range 0 -7.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCounterEdge
member.summary:
Error code: 61
Message: Invalid Counter Edge value.
The counterEdge parameter for the method is not valid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadSpclGate
member.summary:
Error code: 62
Message: Invalid SpecialGate value.
The specialGate parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadReload
member.summary:
Error code: 63
Message: Invalid Reload value.
The reload parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadRecycleFlag
member.summary:
Error code: 64
Message: Invalid Recycle Mode value.
The recycleMode parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadBcdFlag
member.summary:
Error code: 65
Message: Invalid BCD Mode value.
The BCDMode parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either ENABLED or DISABLED (1 or 0).

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadDirection
member.summary:
Error code: 66
Message: Invalid Count Direction value.
The countDirection parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadOutControl
member.summary:
Error code: 67
Message: Invalid Output Control value.
The outputControl parameter to method is not valid. It must be set to either , , , , or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadBitNumber
member.summary:
Error code: 68
Message: Invalid BitNum specified.
The BitNum parameter to method or method is not valid. The valid range of bit numbers depends on the selected Measurement Computing device. If it is a DIO24 compatible Measurement Computing device, the maximum bit number is 23. If it's a DIO96 Measurement Computing device, the maximum bit number is 95. (See Measurement Computing device-specific information.)

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoneEnabled
member.summary:
Error code: 69
Message: None of the counter channels were enabled.
None of the counter channels were marked as in the cntrControl array that was passed to method. At least one of the counter channels must be Enabled.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCtrControl
member.summary:
Error code: 70
Message: An element of Cntr Control array not set to ENABLED or DISABLED.
One of the elements of the cntrControl array that was passed to method was set to something other than or . The array must have the same number of elements as the number of counters on the Measurement Computing device, and all elements must be set to either Enabled or Disabled.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadExpChan
member.summary:
Error code: 71
Message: Invalid EXP channel specified.
An invalid channel was passed to one of the thermocouple input commands. The channel number when using a Measurement Computing EXP device must be >= 16. The maximum allowable channel number depends on which Measurement Computing EXP device is being used (and how many of them). Refer to the Measurement Computing device manual to find the number of channels.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.WrongAdRange
member.summary:
Error code: 72
Message: Board set to wrong A/D range for reading thermocouples.
A thermocouple input method was called to read a Measurement Computing EXP device input. The Measurement Computing EXP device is connected to an A/D board with hardware selected gain that is set to the wrong range. When using Measurement Computing EXP devices with thermocouples, the A/D must be set to the -5 to +5 volt range when available. When using RTD sensors, the range is 0 to 10 V when available.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.OutOfRange
member.summary:
Error code: 73
Message: Temperature input is out of range.
A thermocouple input method returned an invalid temperature. This usually indicates an open thermocouple on a temperature input channel.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadTempScale
member.summary:
Error code: 74
Message: Invalid temperature scale specified.
The scale parameter to a thermocouple input method is not valid. It must be set to either , , or .

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadErrCode
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoQueue
member.summary:
Error code: 76
Message: Specified board does not have channel/gain queue.
The method that was called requires that the Measurement Computing device has a channel/gain queue. The specified Measurement Computing device does not have a queue.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.ContinuousCount
member.summary:
Error code: 77
Message: Count must be > packet size to use recycle mode.
The count parameter is not valid for continuous mode. Using mode, the count parameter must be large enough to cause at least one interrupt. This is usually half the size of the Measurement Computing devices FIFO (typical sizes are 256, 512 and 1024). See Measurement Computing device-specific information for details.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Underrun
member.summary:
Error code: 78
Message: D/A FIFO went empty during output.
The specified D/A output rate could not be sustained. This error should not normally occur.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadMemMode
member.summary:
Error code: 79
Message: Invalid memory mode specified.
The memory mode that was selected with the method is not one of the valid modes.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.FreqOverrun
member.summary:
Error code: 80
Message: Measured frequency too high for selected gating interval.
The gating interval used with method is too long to measure the frequency of the signal connected to the counter. The counter is overflowing. Decrease the gating interval to eliminate the error.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoCjcChan
member.summary:
Error code: 81
Message: A CJC Channel must be configured to make temperature measurements.
When the Measurement Computing device was installed (with the InstaCal installation program) no CJC channel was selected. To use the temperature measurement methods with thermocouples you must first select a CJC channel on the A/D Measurement Computing device and then rerun the installation program.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadChipNum
member.summary:
Error code: 82
Message: Invalid ChipNum specified.
An invalid chipNum parameter was used with the method. If the Measurement Computing device is a five-channel Measurement Computing counter device, then chipNum should be set to 0. If it is a 10-channel counter device, chipNum should be either 0 or 1.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DigNotEnabled
member.summary:
Error code: 83
Message: The digital I/O on this board is not enabled.
When the Measurement Computing device was installed (with the InstaCal installation program), the expansion digital I/O was set to disabled. To use these digital I/O lines you must enable the digital I/O on the Measurement Computing device (with a jumper), re-run the installation program and set the digital I/O to enabled.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Convert16Bits
member.summary:
Error code: 84
Message: CONVERT option can not be used with 16 bit A/D converters.
When using a 16-bit A/D Measurement Computing device, if you try to use the CONVERT option with method or call method you will get this error. (This has been updated so that it is ignored for Measurement Computing devices for which it is inappropriate in later versions of the library.)

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoMemBoard
member.summary:
Error code: 85
Message: The EXTMEMORY option requires that a MEGA-FIFO be attached.
Attempt to use a Mem__ method without a MEGA-FIFO Measurement Computing device installed. Install MEGA-FIFO through InstaCal.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DtActive
member.summary:
Error code: 86
Message: No memory read/write allowed while DT transfer in progress.
A read or write to a memory Measurement Computing device was attempted while data was being transferred via DT Connect.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotMemConf
member.summary:
Error code: 87
Message: Specified board is not a memory board.
The specified Measurement Computing device is not a memory device. This method only works with memory Measurement Computing devices.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.OddChan
member.summary:
Error code: 88
Message: The first channel in scan and number of channels must be even (0, 2, 4, etc).
Some Measurement Computing devices use a channel/gain queue that require the first channel in the queue and the number of channels in the queue always be an even channel. This error can occur even when you are not in the process of loading the queue. Some Measurement Computing devices use the queue automatically with the method. On those Measurement Computing devices, the low channel must be an even number.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CtrNoInit
member.summary:
Error code: 89
Message: Counter was not configured or initialized.
You attempted to use the method or method before initializing and configuring the counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Not8536Ctr
member.summary:
Error code: 90
Message: This board does not have an 8536 counter chip.
Attempt to use 8536 initialization or configuration on Measurement Computing device without 8536 chip.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.FreeRunning
member.summary:
Error code: 91
Message: Board doesn't time A/D sampling. Collecting at fastest possible speed.
This Measurement Computing device does not have an A/D pacer mechanism and you have called the method. The A/D is sampled in a tight software loop as fast as the CPU can execute the instructions. The sampling speed of sampling depends on the computer and the concurrent tasks.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Interrupted
member.summary:
Error code: 92
Message: Operation interrupted with Ctrl-C key.
A foreground operation was stopped before completion because either the Ctrl-C or Ctrl-Break keys were pressed.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoSelectors
member.summary:
Error code: 93
Message: No selector could be allocated.
A Windows selector required by the library could not be allocated. Close any unneeded open Windows applications and try again.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoBurstMode
member.summary:
Error code: 94
Message: This board does not support burst mode.
An attempt was made to use the option on a Measurement Computing device which does not support that option.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotWindowsFunc
member.summary:
Error code: 95
Message: This method is not available in Windows library.
The library method you called is not supported in the current revision of Universal Library for Windows Languages. It may be supported in the future. Contact technical support.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotSimulConf
member.summary:
Error code: 96
Message: Board not configured for SIMULTANEOUS option.
The configuration file of the D/A Measurement Computing device in InstaCal must be set for simultaneous update before you use the option.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.EvenOddMismatch
member.summary:
Error code: 97
Message: An even channel is in an odd slot in the queue, or vice versa.
The channel gain queue on some A/D Measurement Computing devices has a restriction that the channel numbers must be in even queue positions and odd channel numbers must be in odd queue positions.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.M1RateWarning
member.summary:
Error code: 98
Message: Sampling speed to system memory MAY be too fast.
The A/D Measurement Computing device sampling speed you have requested may be too fast for the computer system bus transfer to complete before the next packet is ready for transfer. If this is the case, data is overrun and sample data is corrupted. This warning is initiated whenever you request a sample rate over 625 kHz, AND the sample set is larger than the FIFO buffer on the Measurement Computing device, AND an external memory Measurement Computing device, such as a MEGA-FIFO is not being used. Your system may be able to handle the rate requested. Determine the correct sampling speed through experimentation. Your system may be capable of the full 1 MHz rate directly to system memory.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotRS485
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NotDosFunc
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.RangeMismatch
member.summary:
Error code: 101
Message: Bipolar and unipolar ranges cannot be used together in A/D queue.
The channel/gain queue should only be loaded (via the method) with all unipolar or bipolar ranges

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.ClockTooSlow
member.summary:
Error code: 102
Message: Sampling rate is too high for clock speed, change clock jumper on board.
The sampling rate that you requested is too fast. The A/D Measurement Computing device pacer might be capable of running at a higher rate. Check the Measurement Computing device for an XTAL jumper and, if it is not set for the highest rate, place the jumper in the position for the highest rate. Once the jumper is set, re-run InstaCal.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadCalFactors
member.summary:
Error code: 103
Message: Calibration factors are invalid - Disabling software calibration.
The selected Measurement Computing device uses software calibration and the stored calibration factors are invalid. Run InstaCal and calibrate the Measurement Computing device before using it.

member.summary:
Error code: 104
Message: Invalid configuration information type specified.
An invalid configType parameter was passed to either method or method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadConfigItem
member.summary:
Error code: 105
Message: Invalid configuration item specified.
An invalid configItem parameter was passed to either method or method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoPcmciaBoard
member.summary:
Error code: 106
Message: Cannot access the PCMCIA board.
Cannot access the specified PCMCIA Measurement Computing device. Make sure that the PCMCIA Card and Socket Services are installed correctly and that the Measurement Computing device was installed in the system correctly via InstaCal.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoBackground
member.summary:
Error code: 107
Message: Board does not support background operation.
The option was used and the specified Measurement Computing device does not support background operation.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.StringTooShort

Error code: 108
Message: The string parameter is too short for the string being returned.
The string parameter passed to a library method is too small to contain the string that is being returned. Increase the size of the string to the minimum size specified for the method that you are using.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.ConvertExtMem
member.summary:
Error code: 109
Message: CONVERTDATA is not allowed with EXTMEMORY option.
You requested both the and option. These options can not be used together. Collect the data without the ConvertData option. Once the data has been collected, read it back from the memory card by using the method or the method, and then use the method to convert the data.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadEuAdd
member.summary:
Error code: 110
Message: Program error - bad values used in method or method.
Invalid floating point data was used in method or method. Check the parameters passed to the relevant method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Das16JrRateWarning
member.summary:
Error code: 111
Message: Rates greater than 125 kHz must use the onboard 10 MHz clock.
If a rate greater than 125 kHz is selected and the Measurement Computing device jumper is set for 1 MHz, this warning is generated. Place the jumper on the 10 MHz position and update your InstaCal settings.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.Das08TooLowRate
member.summary:
Error code: 112
Message: The desired sample rate is below hardware minimum.
Increase the value of the rate parameter in method. The lowest pacer frequency is the clock frequency (usually 8 MHz / 2) divided by 65535.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.AmbigSensorOnGp
member.summary:
Error code: 114
Message: More than one temperature sensor type defined for EXP-GP.
Thermocouple and RTD types are both defined for a Measurement Computing EXP device. The method and methods require that only one be defined to operate. Set one of the sensor types to "Not Installed" within the appropriate InstaCal menu.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoSensorTypeOnGp
member.summary:
Error code: 115
Message: No temperature sensor type defined for EXP-GP.
Neither Thermocouple nor RTD types are defined for an EXP-GP. The method and methods require that one and only one be defined to operate. Set one of the sensor types to a predefined type within the appropriate InstaCal menu.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoConversionNeeded
member.summary:
Error code: 116
Message: Selected 12-bit board already returns converted data.
Some 12-bit Measurement Computing devices do not need to have their data converted after a call to method with the option. These Measurement Computing devices return no channel tags and therefore return data in its proper format.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoExtContinuous

mode is ignored when used with the option.

member.summary:
Error code: 123

member.summary:
Error code: 127
Message: The CBUL.386 virtual device driver is not installed.
The Windows device driver CBUL.386 is not installed on your system. Normally, it will be automatically installed when you run the standard installation program. The following line should be in your \windows\system.ini file in the [386Enh] section.
device=c:\mcc\cbul.386

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoWindowsMemory
member.summary:
Error code: 128
Message: Requested amount of Windows page-locked memory is not available.
The Windows device driver could not allocate the required amount of physical memory. This error should not normally occur unless you are collecting very large amounts of data or your system is very memory constrained. If you are collecting a very large block of memory, try collecting a smaller amount. If this is not an option, than consider using method instead of method. Also, if you are running other programs, try shutting them down.

member.summary:
Error code: 133
Message: No DMA memory available to device driver.
The Windows device driver could not allocate the minimum required amount of memory for DMA. If you are sampling at slower speeds, you can specify SINGLEIO in the Options parameter to method. This will prevent the library from attempting to use DMA. In general though, this error should not ordinarily occur. Contact technical support with the details.

Message: The file is not a valid Measurement Computing binary file.
The binary file was not logged from a Measurement Computing USB device with data logging capability, or the binary file was logged during a data logging session that was not properly terminated and is missing information.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.InvalidDelimiter
member.summary:
Error code: 349
Message: An invlid delimiter was specified for CSV file .
A comma is the only valid delimiter when converting to a CSV file.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.InternalErr32
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CfgFileReadFailure
member.summary:
Error code: 304
Message: Error reading from configuration file.
The program was unable to read configuration file CB.CFG Confirm that CB.CFG was not deleted, moved, or renamed since the software installation.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CfgFileWriteFailure
member.summary:
Error code: 305
Message: Error writing to configuration file.
The program was unable to write to the configuration file CB.CFG Confirm that CB.CFG is present and that its attributes are not set for read-only. Also, check that not more than one application is trying to access this file.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CfgFileCantOpen
member.summary:
Error code: 308
Message: Cannot open configuration file.
The program was unable to open the configuration file CB.CFG Confirm that CB.CFG was not deleted, moved, or renamed since the software installation.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadRtdConversion
member.summary:
Error code: 325
Message: Overflow of RTD conversion.
Either method or method returned an invalid temperature conversion. Confirm that the configuration matches the RTD type, and physical Measurement Computing EXP device settings; pay particular attention to gain settings and RTD base resistance. Also, check that the RTD leads are securely attached to the EXP terminals. Finally, confirm that the Measurement Computing device is measuring reasonable voltages via method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoPciBios
member.summary:
Error code: 326
Message: PCI BIOS not present on the PC.
Could not locate the BIOS for the PCI bus. Consult PC supplier for proper installation of the PCI BIOS.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.BadPciIndex
member.summary:
Error code: 327
Message: Specified PCI board not detected.
The specified Measurement Computing PCI board was not detected. Check that the Measurement Computing PCI board is securely installed into the PCI slot. Also, run InstaCal to locate/set valid base address and configuration.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoPciBoard
member.summary:
Error code: 328
Message: Specified PCI board not detected.
The specified Measurement Computing PCI board was not detected. Check that the Measurement Computing PCI board is securely installed into the PCI slot. Also, run InstaCal to locate/set valid base address and configuration.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.CantInstallInt
member.summary:
Error code: 334
Message: Cannot install interrupt handler. IRQ already in use.
The device driver could not enable requested interrupt. Check that the selected IRQ is not already in use by another device. This error can also occur if a foreground scan was aborted; in such cases, rebooting the PC corrects the problem.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.PcmciaErrs
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DosFileNotFound
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DosPathNotFound
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.DosReadFault
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.WinCannotEnableInt
member.summary:
Error code: 603
Message: Cannot enable interrupt. IRQ already in use.
The device driver could not enable requested interrupt. Check that the selected IRQ is not already in use by another device. This error can also occur if a foreground scan was aborted.
In such cases, rebooting the PC corrects the problem.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.WinCannotDisableInt
member.summary:
Error code: 605
Message: Cannot disable interrupts.
The device driver was unable to disable the IRQ. This can occur when interrupts are generated too fast for the PC to complete servicing. For example, sampling at high frequencies (above ~2 kHz) with scan mode set for can lead to this error. Frequently, an error accompanies this condition.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.WinCantPageLockBuffer
member.summary:
Error code: 606
Message: Insufficient memory to page lock data buffer.
There is not enough physical memory to lock down the entire data buffer. Try closing out other applications, selecting smaller data buffers, or installing additional RAM.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.NoPcmCard
member.summary:
Error code: 630
Message: PCM card not detected.
The specified PCMCIA card was not detected. Confirm that the PCM card is securely plugged into PCMCIA slot. If the Measurement Computing device continues to return this error, run InstaCal to reset the configuration.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.InvalidGainArrayLength
member.summary:
Error code: 801
Message: The number of elements in the gain array must equal the number of channels in the scan.
method was called with the number of elements in not equal to the number of channels specified by the parameter.
Make sure that the number of elements in the array is the same as the number of channels in the scan.
Make sure that the length of dimension 0 in the array is the same as the number of channels in the scan.
The Universal Library does not print or stop if this error occurs, regardless of the error handling configuration specified by the call to the method. These errors must be checked by examining the ErrorInfo object returned from the method.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorInfo.ErrorCode.InvalidDimension0Length
member.summary:
Error code: 802
Message: The length of dimension 0 in the data array must equal the number of channels in the scan.
Either the method or the method was called with the length of dimension 0 of the array not equal to the number of channels specified by the parameter.
Make sure that the length of dimension 0 in the array is the same as the number of channels in the scan.
The Universal Library does not print or stop if this error occurs, regardless of the error handling configuration specified by the call to the method. These errors must be checked by examining the ErrorInfo object returned from the method or the method.

member.name: T:MccDaq.cExpansionConfig
member.summary: Provides members for setting and getting Measurement Computing expansion device information.
member.remarks: All instances of cExpansionConfig are derived from the MccBoard. property.

example.code:
Dim Status As ErrorInfo Dim Board0 As MccBoard Dim configVal As Integer Dim devNum As Integer = 1
Board0 = New MccBoard(0) Status = Board0.ExpansionConfig.GetBoardType(devNum, configVal)

member.name: T:MccDaq.ErrorReporting
member.summary: Defines all options for the library to print error messages on the screen.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorReporting.DontPrint
member.summary: Errors do not not generate a message to the screen.
member.remarks: Your program must check the returned error code after each library call to determine if an error occurred.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorReporting.PrintWarnings
member.summary: Only warning errors will generate a message to the screen.
member.remarks: Your program must check the returned error code to determine if a fatal error occurred.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorReporting.PrintFatal
member.summary: Only fatal errors will generate a message to the screen.
member.remarks: Your program must check the returned error code to determine if a warning error occurred.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorReporting.PrintAll
member.summary: All errors will generate a message to the screen.

member.name: T:MccDaq.ErrorHandling
member.summary: Defines all options for handling errors.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorHandling.DontStop
member.summary: The program continues to execute when an error occurs.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorHandling.StopFatal
member.summary: The program stops when a "fatal" error occurs.

member.name: F:MccDaq.ErrorHandling.StopAll
member.summary: The program stops when an error occurs.
member.remarks: If you are running in an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) when an error occurs, the environment may be shut down along with the program. If your IDE behaves this way, set method to . You can check error codes to determine the cause of the error.

member.summary: Specifies all of the digital port types for bit level input/output methods.

member.summary: AuxPort I/O for bit-level input/output methods.

member.summary: Specifies the digital port types for bit level configuration.

member.summary: AuxPort is configured for bit-level configuration.

member.name: T:MccDaq.DigitalLogicState
member.summary: Specifies the available digital logic states.

member.name: F:MccDaq.DigitalLogicState.Low
member.summary: The digital logic state is logic low (0).

member.name: F:MccDaq.DigitalLogicState.High
member.summary: The digital logic state is logic high (1).

member.name: T:MccDaq.CtrlOutput
member.summary: Specifies how to link counter 1 with counter 2 on a 8536 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CtrlOutput.NotLinked
member.summary: Counter 1 is not connected to any other counters inputs.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CtrlOutput.GateCtr2
member.summary: The output of counter 1 is connected to the GATE of counter 2.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CtrlOutput.TrigCtr2
member.summary: The output of counter 1 is connected to the trigger of counter 2.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CtrlOutput.InCtr2
member.summary: The output of counter 1 is connected to the counter 2 clock input.

member.name: T:MccDaq.C8254Mode
member.summary: Specifies the operating mode for an 8254 counter.
member.remarks: Refer to the 8254 data sheet for a detailed description of the 8254 counter/timer device.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.HighOnLastCount
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) transitions from low to high on the terminal count, and remains high until reset.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.OneShot
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) transitions from high to low on rising edge of GATE N, then back to high on the terminal count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.RateGenerator
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) pulses low for one clock cycle on the terminal count, reloads the counter, and recycles.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.SquareWave
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) is high for count less than 1/2 terminal count, then low until terminal count, whereupon it recycles. This mode generates a square wave

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.SoftwareStrobe
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) pulses low for one clock cycle on the terminal count. Count starts after the counter is loaded.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8254Mode.HardwareStrobe
member.summary: The output of the counter (OUT N) pulses low for one clock cycle on the terminal count. Count starts on the rising edge at GATE N input

member.name: T:MccDaq.Reload
member.summary: Specifies the options for reloading the 9513 counter when in recycle mode.

member.name: F:MccDaq.Reload.LoadReg
member.summary: The counter is reloaded from the Load register.

member.name: F:MccDaq.Reload.LoadAndHoldReg
member.summary: The count is alternately reloaded from the Load or Hold register.
member.remarks: When in mode X, the count is reloaded from the Load.

member.name: T:MccDaq.RecycleMode
member.summary: Specifies the recycle mode options for 9513 and 8536 counters.

member.name: F:MccDaq.RecycleMode.OneTime
member.summary: The count is performed once.

member.name: F:MccDaq.RecycleMode.Recycle
member.summary: The counter will automatically reload to the starting count every time it reaches 0, then continue counting.

member.name: T:MccDaq.BCDMode
member.summary: Specifies the counting format options in which a counter may operate. Only used for Measurement Computing devices with 9513 counters.

member.name: F:MccDaq.BCDMode.Disabled
member.summary: The counter operates in a binary count format.

member.name: F:MccDaq.BCDMode.Enabled
member.summary: The counter operates in a Binary Coded Decimal count format.

member.name: T:MccDaq.CountDirection
member.summary: Specifies the counting direction of a 9513 counting device.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CountDirection.CountDown
member.summary: The 9513 device counts down.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CountDirection.CountUp
member.summary: The 9513 device counts up.

member.name: T:MccDaq.CountEdge
member.summary: Specifies the edge used for counting by a 9513 counter/timer device.
member.remarks: CountEdge is referred to as "Source Edge" in the 9513 datasheet.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CountEdge.PositiveEdge
member.summary: The 9513 counts on the rising edge.

member.name: F:MccDaq.CountEdge.NegativeEdge
member.summary: The 9513 counts on the falling edge.

member.name: T:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl
member.summary: Specifies the output types from a 9513 counter.
member.remarks: Refer to the 9513 data sheet for a detailed description of the 9513 counter/timer device.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl.AlwaysLow
member.summary: The output type is inactive, output low.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl.HighPulseOnTc
member.summary: The output type is High Pulse on Terminal Count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl.ToggleOnTc
member.summary: The output type is TC toggled.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl.Disconnected
member.summary: The output type is inactive, output high impedance.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C9513OutputControl.LowPulseOnTc
member.summary: The output type is active low, terminal count pulse.

member.name: T:MccDaq.C8536OutputControl
member.summary: Specifies the action of the output signal from an 8536 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536OutputControl.HighPulseOnTc
member.summary: The output signal transitions from low-to-high for one clock pulse on terminal count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536OutputControl.ToggleOnTc
member.summary: The output signal changes state on the terminal count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536OutputControl.HighUntilTc
member.summary: The output signal transitions to high at the start of counting, and then goes low on the terminal count.

member.name: T:MccDaq.C8536TriggerType
member.summary: Sets the type of trigger used on an 8536 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536TriggerType.HWStartTrig
member.summary: The first trigger on the Z8254 counter's trigger input starts the loading of the initial count. Counting proceeds from the initial count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536TriggerType.HWRetrig
member.summary: Every trigger on the counter's trigger input starts the loading of the initial count. Counting proceeds from the initial count.

member.name: F:MccDaq.C8536TriggerType.SWStartTrig
member.summary: The method starts the loading of the initial count. Counting proceeds from the initial count.

member.name: T:MccDaq.GateControl
member.summary: Specifies all of the gating modes for configuring a 9513 counter.

member.name: F:MccDaq.GateControl.NoGate
member.summary: The gating mode is no gating.

member.name: F:MccDaq.GateControl.AHLTcPrevCtr
member.summary: The gating mode is Active High TCN –1.

member.name: F:MccDaq.GateControl.AHLNextGate
member.summary: The gating mode is Active High Level GATE N + 1.

member.name: F:MccDaq.GateControl.AHLPrevGate
member.summary: The gating mode is Active High Level GATE N – 1.

member.name: F:MccDaq.GateControl.AHLGate
member.summary: The gating mode is Active Low Edge GATE N.
